body:
@joel-costigliola 

Map and List do not work with the as() method either.

This does not compile:
`Assertions.assertThat(map).as("").containsOnlyKeys("Key1","Key2")`

I don't understand @PascalSchumacher as the following returns the same object:

```
System.out.println(Assertions.assertThat(map));
System.out.println(Assertions.assertThat(map).as(""));
```

I thought maybe that as() only worked with primitves, but BigDecimal works.

Please do not just "close" this issue.  Either find a fix or update the documentation for the assertThat() methods that do not work with as() so others don't have to do the research that at least 2 of us have now done.  Lists and Maps are commonly used.

Thanks.
I'll have another look at it after my holidays :-)

@Holzberg please let me know with which environment you are experiencing  the problem.

In absence of feedback, I will most certainly close this issue in a week or two ...
Interesting ... I'll see what I can do, thanks for taking the time to do more testing.
No problem... thanks for taking the time to look into it :)

My current understanding is that when a method is specifying generic parameters (like  `containsOnlyKeys`) and java does not know the generic type used in the calling object (like `map1`) it cannot fulfill the expected requirements and won't compile.

Interesingly, if you define `map1` as `Map<Object,?>` the following assertion compiles fine:

``` java
Assertions.assertThat(map1).as("").containsOnlyKeys("Key1","Key2");
```

I will continue investigating but my gut feeling is that to solve this issue, AssertJ should get rid of generic parameters which I'm not sure most users would agree.

To be continued ...

rename.from: as() and describedAs() are not working on all object types
rename.to: as() and describedAs() are not working on raw object types

body:
BTW this will also address code using basic assertions before map ones, e.g. 

``` java
assertThat(map1).isNotNull().containsOnlyKeys("Key1", "Key2"); 
```
Yeah I know, every generic typed assertion will have the same pb.
